summary: This document is a chain of emails from the U.S. Attorney's Office (Southern District of New York) regarding travel approval requests for a team investigating the Epstein case (2018R01618). The emails detail multiple trips planned for 2019 to conduct victim interviews and meetings in Los Angeles, CA and West Palm Beach/Fort Lauderdale, FL.

connections.description: Both are part of the same investigation team from the U.S. Attorney's Office traveling together for case-related interviews.

events.title: Planned Interview Trip to Los Angeles
events.description: The investigation team requests travel approval for an interview (or interviews) in Los Angeles on December 16 and/or 17, 2019.

events.title: Planned Interview Trip to Los Angeles
events.description: The team requests permission to travel for an interview in Los Angeles on November 14, 2019.

events.title: Planned Interview Trip to West Palm Beach
events.description: The team requests permission to travel for an interview in West Palm Beach on November 4, 2019, with plans to reserve a hotel conference room.

events.title: Planned Victim Interview Trip to Los Angeles
events.description: The team requests permission to travel for a victim interview in Los Angeles, tentatively planning to fly mid-week.

events.title: Planned Meetings/Interviews Trip to West Palm Beach
events.description: The team requests permission to travel for approximately three days for meetings and interviews with victims in West Palm Beach, Florida.

events.title: Planned Meetings/Interviews Trip to West Palm Beach
events.description: The team requests permission to travel for approximately three days for meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach, Florida, related to United States v. Epstein.

events.title: Initial Travel Request for Epstein Investigation
events.description: S requests permission for travel for United States v. Epstein, an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity, for two days of meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale, Florida.

keyFacts: The document references the ongoing federal investigation 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618', described as 'an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity'.
The U.S. Attorney's Office (Southern District of New York) team was actively conducting victim interviews and meetings in Los Angeles and Florida throughout 2019 as part of the Epstein investigation.
Multiple travel requests indicate a pattern of investigative work, often involving the need to reserve hotel conference rooms for interviews.
The correspondence shows bureaucratic processes (travel approvals, per diem calculations) within the DOJ related to the high-profile investigation.
The investigation case number '2018R01618' is consistently referenced, indicating a centralized, ongoing federal probe.
